hi there: i have a problem with my ubuntu linux
whenever I try to install some packages, like for example j2sdk1.4m it complains that requires libc6(>=2.3.2.ds1-21), but it also sais that 2.3.2.ds1-20ubuntu13 is going to be installed
so I cant put j2sdk on my computer
Just install the ubuntu package and not the Debian one.
Check the wiki url ubotu just posted; it explains.
You're installing a *debian( java which hads *debian* depends. Not Ubuntu ones.
Then you have a fairly broken sources.list with non-ubuntu repositories.
Mixing pckages is a bad idea at best and will destroy the system at worst.
In that case, you'll need to go to java.sun.com and download the j2se_1.5.04-*.bin (whatever the latest version is) - NOT the .bin.rpm, but the .bin.
That way yopu'll get the latest. Once downloaded, you can run 'make-jpkg j2dsk.....bin', which will create a .deb for you.
